member.name: T:Footloose.Configuration.Fluent.XmppTransportChannelConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration class for the .

member.name: M:Footloose.Configuration.Fluent.XmppTransportChannelConfiguration.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default settings.

member.name: M:Footloose.Configuration.Fluent.XmppTransportChannelConfiguration.Credentials(System.Net.NetworkCredential)
member.summary: Specify the for authentication with the XMPP server. is the user part, is the server part of the XMPP Jid.
member.param: with user name, passwort and XMPP server domain.

member.name: M:Footloose.Configuration.Fluent.XmppTransportChannelConfiguration.ConnectionType(Footloose.Configuration.XmppConnectionType)
member.summary: Specify the XMPP connection type to the remote XMPP server. Default is TCP.

member.name: M:Footloose.Configuration.Fluent.XmppTransportChannelConfiguration.ServerAddress(System.String)
member.summary: Specify the XMPP server to connect. Use this setting for XMPP servers without SRV records or as Uri for BOSH connections.
member.param: Address of the XMPP server to connect or a BOSH Uri.

member.name: M:Footloose.Configuration.Fluent.XmppTransportChannelConfiguration.Port(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specify the XMPP server port to connect. Default is 5222.

member.name: M:Footloose.Configuration.Fluent.XmppTransportChannelConfiguration.AutoResolveServerAddress
member.summary: Enables auto resolve of the XMPP server address via SRV DNS Records. Default is on.

member.name: M:Footloose.Configuration.Fluent.XmppTransportChannelConfiguration.UseCompression
member.summary: Enables the use of XMPP stream compression to save bandwidth. Default is off.

member.name: M:Footloose.Configuration.Fluent.XmppTransportChannelConfiguration.UseTls
member.summary: Enables the use of Start-TLS for TLS XMPP stream encryption and compression. Default is on.
member.remarks: See RFC 2246 for further details: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2246.txt

member.name: M:Footloose.Configuration.Fluent.XmppTransportChannelConfiguration.UseSingleSignOn
member.summary: Enables the use of Single Sign On (SSO). Default is off.
member.remarks:
Single Sign on (SSO) is using Kerberos to authenticate you with your Windows credentials on the XMPP server without the need for provide username and password.
A XMPP Server which supports Kerberos authentication is required.

member.name: M:Footloose.Configuration.Fluent.XmppTransportChannelConfiguration.RemoteCertificateValidationCallback(System.Net.Security.RemoteCertificateValidationCallback)
member.summary: Specify the callback that verifies the remote Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificate used for authentication.

member.summary: Applies the transport channel configuration data to the .

member.name: M:Footloose.TransportChannels.Xmpp.XmppConnectionManager.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.
member.param: Indicator that the method as been called by user's code.
